title: Ancient & Medieval Medicine: From Galen to Harvey
description: The foundations of Western medicine from Galen's ancient synthesis through Harvey's discovery of blood circulation and Vesalius's anatomical revolution.
keyWorks: Galen's Corpus: Ancient authority on medicine for 1400 years, four humors, pneuma theory
Vesalius De Fabrica (1543): Modern scientific anatomy through direct observation
Harvey De Motu Cordis (1628): Discovery of blood circulation, overthrew Galenic physiology
researchValue: Documents the ancient medical tradition that dominated for over a millennium and its revolutionary overthrow in the 16th-17th centuries. Galen's works show ancient medical theory. Vesalius and Harvey represent the birth of modern medicine through empirical observation.
